title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Stefon Diggs may be cut to save $16.8 million in cap space, despite his strong performance with the Patriots.
Mack Hollins and DeMario Douglas are potential candidates for cut or trade due to their non-guaranteed contracts.
Linebacker Christian Elliss could be released to reduce cap costs, saving New England several million dollars.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not play in Sunday's game against the 76ers as he recovers from a right Achilles injury.
Philadelphia 76ers' center Joel Embiid is out with an oblique strain and will miss the next three games.
The Celtics recently won eight of their last ten games and are second in the Eastern Conference standings.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran has hit three home runs in spring training, including two against left-handed pitchers.
Duran's performance raises possibilities for his role in the Red Sox lineup, despite 2025 struggles against lefties.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora notes Duran's improved hitting, potentially making him a strong candidate for the lineup's three spot.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins prospects James Hagens and Dean Letourneau have scored 39 goals for Boston College this season.
Dean Letourneau has improved from zero goals in his freshman year to 19 goals as a sophomore at Boston College.
The Bruins' prospect pool, including players like Hagens, is contributing to Boston's optimistic outlook for future seasons.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: An NBA Western Conference assistant coach predicts the Boston Celtics will win the Eastern Conference despite trailing the Pistons.
The Celtics lead the NBA with a 9.9 net rating since Thanksgiving, showing strong offensive performance without Jayson Tatum.
Boston is closely competing with Detroit in metrics, but lacks creators compared to Boston's Jaylen Brown and potential return of Tatum.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed a mix of new and old songs at the Boch Center Wang Theatre.
The setlist included tracks like 'It Gets Easier' and covers of Drive-By Truckers songs such as 'Decoration Day'.
The show featured a mix of Americana, Southern rock, and folk, with highlights like 'Cover Me Up' and 'King of Oklahoma'.

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots unlikely to acquire top edge rushers like Maxx Crosby or Trey Hendrickson due to high trade demands and free agent costs.
Free agents like Trey Hendrickson, Jaelan Phillips, and Odafe Oweh remain top targets but may be financially out of reach for Patriots.
Patriots may focus on NFL Draft for edge rushers, holding 31st pick, with Zion Young from Missouri emerging as a potential option.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount aims to purchase Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion, which may integrate CBS and TNT/TBS sports coverage.
CBS might expand MLB and NHL broadcasts under Warner Bros.' umbrella, leveraging existing NCAA basketball coverage synergy.
NFL might sell more games to streaming platforms; Netflix may challenge CBS for future NFL broadcasting rights.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots show interest in Eagles' A.J. Brown, concerned about current asking price involving high draft picks.
Trading Brown before June 1 would cost Eagles $44 million in dead money, creating future cap issues.
Patriots may retain Stefon Diggs; cap restructuring required with potential Brown trade, per team reports.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts introduces sticker tags for E-ZPass, replacing hard-plastic transponders with RFID technology starting Sunday.
New E-ZPass sticker tags will be provided free to users, eliminating the $20 transponder replacement fee.
Switching to sticker tags is projected to save Massachusetts $7.38 million annually, costing 55 cents each to produce.
